# _Fabio Tudone_ (ITA/EUR citizen, 38)

![Fabio.png](https://github.com/circlespainter/circlespainter.github.io/Fabio.jpg)

- Currently **Software Engineer** @ [Parallel Universe](http://www.paralleluniverse.co/)
- Residing in **northern Israel** with **unlimited working Visa**
- **Languages**: Italian (native), English (from self-study, fluent), French (from high-school, once fluent, now rusty), Hebrew (basic, actively self-studying)
- **E-Mail**: ftudone [AT] libero [DOT] it
- **Skype**: ftudone
- [Twitter](https://twitter.com/ftudone)
- [LinkedIn](https://it.linkedin.com/in/fabiotudone)

# Work

- [Quasar](http://docs.paralleluniverse.co/quasar/), [Pulsar](http://docs.paralleluniverse.co/pulsar/), [Comsat](http://docs.paralleluniverse.co/comsat/), [Capsule](http://capsule.io)
- [Parallel Universe Blog write-ups](http://blog.paralleluniverse.co/) (articles with author "Fabio")
- [DZone](https://dzone.com/users/1450043/circlespainter.html)
- [Java Code Geeks](https://www.javacodegeeks.com/author/fabio-tudone/)
- [JetBrains guest write-ups and webinars](https://blog.jetbrains.com/kotlin/tag/quasar/)
- [jOOQ guest write-ups and webinars](https://blog.jooq.org/tag/fabio-tudone/)
- [Ongoing collaboration with Oracle for OpenJDK 9 (only public exchanges)](http://openjdk.5641.n7.nabble.com/template/NamlServlet.jtp?macro=user_nodes&user=3292)
- [StackExchange activity](http://stackexchange.com/users/4635403/circlespainter)

- [Comsat user group support activity](https://groups.google.com/forum/#!forum/comsat-user)
- [GitHub activity](https://github.com/circlespainter)
- [Reddit activity](https://www.reddit.com/user/circlespainter)
- Until end of 2014, [Thron (prev. AKA 4ME) enterprise cloud-based DAM](https://www.thron.com/en/)
- [PhD research](https://www.researchgate.net/profile/Fabio_Tudone)

# Tech skills

- **JVM platform** incl. instrumentation (ASM), classloading, optimization, micro-benchmarking (JMH), high-concurrency load testing on AWS
- **Concurrent and distributed programming** (threads, `java.util.concurrent`, async, message-passing & actors, Clojure tools including `core.async`)
- **Cloud architectures**: ReST, high-performance, high-availability, horizontal high-scalability distributed / clustered architectures and especially static and dynamic CDN technologies and practices, Saas/IaaS/PaaS cost modelling, cost monitoring, evolution and upgrade
- **Development/writing tools**: GitHub, Git, JetBrains Idea, Gradle, Leiningen, Maven, Travis CI, Jekyll, MarkDown
- **Languages**: Java/JDK (incl. 8), Clojure, Kotlin (prev. Scala, C++, C; small incursions into Ruby/Rails, Erlang, Elixir, Go)
- **Data**: jOOQ, JDBI, JDBC, Redis, MongoDB, XML (prev. Hibernate)
- **Brokers**: Kafka, 0MQ
- **Server**: Netty, Undertow, Jetty, Dropwizard, JAX-RS (Jersey), Servlet, Ring (Clojure), http-kit (Clojure)
- **Client**: Apache HTTP Client, OkHTTP, Retrofit, (prev. HTML, CSS/Compass, JavaScript, jQuery, EmberJS, various "micro-frameworks")
- **IT/DevOps**: Capsule, Unix (Linux, Mac OS X), bash, LXC, AWS EC2 (prev. S3, ELB, CloudFront, EBS, Route 53, VPC, SMS, Glacier)
- **Frameworks**: Spring
- **Web and mobile content delivery, especially A/V** delivery technologies, tools, architectures and practices

# Values and traits

Goal, value and action orientation; thinking out-of-the-box and forward-thinking; simplicity; smartness; reliability; factuality and fact-checking; autonomy; competence; humbleness (awareness of one's limits); curiosity, study and learning; proactivity; helpfulness; accuracy; realism; balance; communication; cooperation; kindness and compassion; respectfulness; care; honesty; thankfulness; egolessness; appreciation for diversity.

# Looking for

- **Senior Software Engineering role**
- **Equivalent of >= 80K â‚¬/y**
- **Full-time remote work** (40hrs/wk); hours flexibility when possible
- **I'd like to work** about (for example): security, core technologies, development tools, management tools, science, research, environment monitoring, care (e.g. healthcare), culture and culture bridging, social empowering, learning, arts & crafts, tourism & travels, languages, expats, diplomacy, e-government, public utilities, public construction, transportation, disaster relief, humanitarian.
- **I wouldn't like to work** about (for example): e-commerce, advertising, marketing, retail, finance & banking (except ethical), manufacturing.

# Interests

- Science & technology (esp. Computer Science, Physics, Astronomy and Cosmology, Medicine, Biology, Biotechnology, Antropology, Sociology, Psychology, Ethology)
- Cultures, especially philosophy and spirituality of ancient traditions (learning about Judaic tradition; after that interested in other middle-eastern as well as far-eastern ones, especially Japanese linked to Zen Buddhism).
- Writing
- Languages (learning Hebrew; after that interested in Russian, Arabic, Japanese, Chinese)
- Society
- Travelling
- National and international diplomacy and politics
- Music (was self-studying piano and guitar)
- Martial arts
- Food & Cooking

# Experience

### Parallel Universe (2014-present, ISR/USA, OSS core technology and development tools)

- OSS Software Engineer (Quasar, Pulsar, Comsat and Capsule)

### Thron (prev. New Vision, 2009-2014, ITA, cloud-based Enterprise Digital Asset Management):

- CTO
- Development Manager (4ME/Thron Platform)
- Solution Architect
- Team Leader
- Senior Engineer

### Uniters (2008-2009, ITA, manifacturing and restoration)

- Project Lead and Senior Engineer: custom Spring/MySQL-based ERP for international furniture care company

### Finantix (2002-2007, ITA, finance)

- Team Leader (Platform R&D)
- Senior Engineer (Platform R&D): LINQ-style business-level language & Eclipse-based IDE design and implementation on top of Hibernate
- Senior Engineer (J2EE, project)
- Junior Engineer (J2EE, project): UML, J2EE, XML

### Computer Science (Ca' Foscari University, Venice ITA)

- PhD student (2001-2002, ITA): languages and type-systems for distribuited and Mobile Agents programming; cryptographics protocols and programs modeling with methods to integrate them into mobile computing; static analysis of security properties (authentication, secrecy, non-repudiability) via type-systems or other static analysis methods.

# Education

- English PET/B1
- Frequented 1y Computer Science PhD (Ca' Foscari University, Venice ITA)
- Computer Science Master (1996-2001), full grades (Ca' Foscari University, Venice ITA), graduation thesis: "A distributed implementation of mobile calculi with JoCaml"
- Science-oriented lyceum (1991-1996), full grades
